title: Conjunctions: and, but, or, because
description: Слушайте и определяйте связь между частями предложения.

tasks.audioText: We went to a restaurant last night. I had pasta and my wife had fish.
tasks.transcript: I had pasta and my wife had fish.

options.text: Only the person ate at the restaurant.
Both the person and his wife ordered food.
The wife did not eat anything.
They both had pasta.

tasks.explanation: 'And' connects two things — both people ordered different meals.

tasks.audioText: I wanted to go for a walk. But it was raining outside.

options.text: The weather was good for a walk.
The rain stopped the person from walking.
The person went for a long walk.
It was sunny outside.

tasks.explanation: 'But' shows a contrast — wanting to walk versus the rain.

tasks.audioText: We can eat at home tonight. Or we can go to that new Italian place.
tasks.transcript: Or we can go to that new Italian place.

options.text: There is a second option — eating at an Italian restaurant.
They must eat at home tonight.
They already ate at the Italian place.
The Italian restaurant is closed.

tasks.explanation: 'Or' offers a choice between two options.

tasks.audioText: Lisa did not come to work today. She stayed at home because she was ill.
tasks.transcript: She stayed at home because she was ill.

options.text: Lisa stayed home — the reason was her illness.
Lisa went to work even though she was ill.
Lisa is at the office today.
Lisa stayed home because of the weather.

tasks.explanation: 'Because' gives the reason — she was ill, so she stayed home.

tasks.audioText: I like this coffee shop. The coffee is good and the prices are low.
tasks.transcript: The coffee is good and the prices are low.

options.text: The coffee is bad but cheap.
The prices are very high.
Both the quality and the price are positive.
Only the coffee is good.

tasks.explanation: 'And' adds two positive facts together — good coffee plus low prices.

tasks.audioText: I studied hard for the exam. But I didn't get a good mark.
tasks.transcript: But I didn't get a good mark.

options.text: The person got a great result.
Despite studying hard, the result was poor.
The person did not study at all.
The exam was cancelled.

tasks.explanation: 'But' shows an unexpected contrast — studying hard versus a poor mark.

tasks.audioText: Would you like something to drink? You can have tea or coffee.
tasks.transcript: You can have tea or coffee.

options.text: There are two drink options to choose from.
Only tea is available.
There are no drinks available.
You must have both tea and coffee.

tasks.explanation: 'Or' presents a choice between two drinks.

tasks.audioText: I decided to take a taxi today. I took a taxi because I was late for work.
tasks.transcript: I took a taxi because I was late for work.

options.text: The person took a taxi — the reason was being late.
The person walked to work.
The person was early for work.
The person took a taxi because it was cheap.

tasks.explanation: 'Because' explains the reason — being late caused the taxi decision.

tasks.audioText: I packed my bags for the trip. I brought a jacket and an umbrella.
tasks.transcript: I brought a jacket and an umbrella.

options.text: The person packed two items — a jacket and an umbrella.
The person brought only a jacket.
The person forgot to pack anything.
The person brought sunglasses instead.

tasks.explanation: 'And' connects two items that were both packed.

tasks.audioText: I tried the new gym near my house. The equipment is great but it is very expensive.
tasks.transcript: The equipment is great but it is very expensive.

options.text: The gym has good equipment but costs a lot.
The gym is cheap and has good equipment.
The equipment is old and broken.
The gym is free to use.

tasks.explanation: 'But' shows a contrast — the quality is good, however the price is high.

tasks.audioText: I need a break from work. Should I go to the beach or stay at home?
tasks.transcript: Should I go to the beach or stay at home?

options.text: The person is choosing between two places for a break.
The person decided to go to the beach.
The person must stay at home.
The person does not want a break.

tasks.explanation: 'Or' presents a choice between the beach and home.

tasks.audioText: I could not sleep well last night. I am tired today because I slept only four hours.
tasks.transcript: I am tired today because I slept only four hours.

options.text: The person is tired — the reason is not enough sleep.
The person slept very well.
The person is full of energy today.
The person slept eight hours.

tasks.explanation: 'Because' gives the reason for being tired — only four hours of sleep.

tasks.audioText: We visited the museum yesterday. We saw paintings and sculptures.

options.text: They saw two types of art at the museum.
They saw only paintings.
The museum was closed.
They only saw sculptures.

tasks.explanation: 'And' connects two things they saw — paintings plus sculptures.

tasks.audioText: I wanted to buy the dress I saw. But it was not available in my size.
tasks.transcript: But it was not available in my size.

options.text: The dress was available in the right size.
The person bought the dress.
The dress did not come in the person's size.
The person did not like the dress.

tasks.explanation: 'But' shows that despite wanting the dress, the size was not there.

tasks.audioText: We need to hurry up now. We should leave now because the train leaves in ten minutes.
tasks.transcript: We should leave now because the train leaves in ten minutes.

options.text: They have plenty of time.
They need to go now — the reason is the train departs soon.
The train already left.
They are taking a bus instead.

tasks.explanation: 'Because' gives the reason for leaving — the train departs in ten minutes.

short_description: Conjunctions: связь частей предложения с and, but, or, because
